title: Part (a)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The response accurately includes two of the criteria below.
The response accurately includes all three of the criteria below.

title: Part (b)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that a per-unit subsidy equal to the marginal external benefit will lead to the production of the socially optimal quantity.
The response states that a per-unit subsidy equal to the marginal external benefit will lead to the production of the socially optimal quantity.

title: Part (c)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The response must both state that the price ceiling will not lead to the production of the socially optimal quantity and explain why in order to receive the point.
descriptions: The response does not state that the price ceiling will not result in the socially optimal quantity and/or does not explain that the price ceiling will lower the quantity supplied and increase the quantity demanded, thereby moving the quantity exchanged farther away from the optimal quantity and increasing the deadweight loss.

The response states that the price ceiling will not result in the socially optimal quantity and explains that the price ceiling will lower the quantity supplied and increase the quantity demanded, thereby moving the quantity exchanged farther away from the optimal quantity and increasing the deadweight loss.
